So far, it has proved a successful way of presenting his tough-guy image at home and earned him a fan club (including his own pop song), though it tends to play rather differently outside of Russia, where the stage-managed image of an all-action president can seem over the top.

Though it may seem strange to audiences outside of Russia, the 62-year-old's macho posturing is all part of the image that he has carefully cultivated through state propaganda since taking over the presidency from Boris Yeltsin at the turn of the new millennium.
